Breakfast 31/03/2019 Ben Thompson presents a round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features.(n) General Social Political Issues Economics
2018..
1.7/10
Match of the Day 30/03/2019 Gary Lineker presents highlights of the latest Premier League matches, including Fulham v Manchester City at Craven Cottage and Manchester United v Watford at Old Trafford. Scott Parker's Cottagers were looking like relegation certainties, but the former England midfielder will have still been looking for a decent performance from his players against the reigning champions. Plus, action from Brighton & Hove Albion v Southampton at the Amex Stadium, Burnley v Wolverhampton Wanderers at Turf Moor, Crystal Palace v Huddersfield Town at Selhurst Park, Leicester City v Bournemouth at the King Power Stadium and West Ham United v Everton at London Stadium.(n) Football Soccer
8.3/10
The Andrew Marr Show 31/03/2019 A round-up of the week's stories, featuring interviews with key figures in politics and current affairs and a round-up of the Sunday papers. Including news and weather at 10.00.(n) General News Current Affairs
5.4/10
Sunday Politics The latest political news and debate from a regional perspective.(n) News Magazine Current Affairs
3.2/10

Bargain Hunt Carmarthen 29 Experts Richard Madley and Caroline Hawley head to Jacobs Market in Cardiff to assist two teams keen to bag a bargain in the hope that they will make a profit at auction. There are plenty of highs and lows in the saleroom and presenter Christina Trevanion also visits a local cinema to find out more about a little-known film star from Llanelli.(n) Antiques Collectibles
43.22/32.
3.1/10
Escape to the Country Buckinghamshire Alistair Appleton helps a house hunting couple find a country home with a budget of £700,000 in Buckinghamshire, and later visits a farm that produces high-end snail caviar.(n) Property
16.27/70.
5/10
Brave A princess defies her mother's plans to secure peace by marrying her off to the son of one of their allies. A witch provides the rebellious royal with a magic spell to change her fate, but the enchantment backfires disastrously when the queen is transformed into a bear. Pixar's animated fantasy, with the voices of Kelly Macdonald, Emma Thompson and Billy Connolly.(n) 2012 Adventure
PG
7.5/10
Pointless Celebrities Grange Hill Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman present a special Grange Hill version of the general knowledge quiz. Weather 31/03/2019 Weather
8.8/10
Countryfile Surrey Rural reports from Surrey. Matt Baker uncovers the story of the woman who has inspired generations of conservationists, Helen Skelton visits a biodynamic vineyard, John Craven gets some tips on keeping pigs, and Steve Brown explores the history of the Surrey landscape through sculpture. Plus, Adam Henson considers the impact of Brexit on Britain's farmers and Tom Heap reports on antibiotic-free meat. Including Weather for the Week Ahead.(n) Nature Animals
2018..
6.7/10
Antiques Roadshow Crathes Castle 1 Fiona Bruce presents the show from Crathes Castle in Aberdeenshire. Items brought in to be valued include a royal portrait which is not all that it seems, a Cartier clock, a tiny bowl with a giant price tag, a hat once given to Ronald Reagan and a walking stick belonging to Scottish music hall star Harry Lauder.(n) Antiques Collectibles
40.13/26.
5.7/10
Blue Planet Live Chris Packham, Steve Backshall and Liz Bonnin conclude the week of live programmes with a look at what the future holds for the next generation of marine life, and how scientists are embracing new forms of technology to help preserve sea life. Chris studies humpback whales at the Baja Peninsula, Liz hears an underwater dawn chorus in Australia, as well as encountering turtle hatchlings and fluorescent corals, while Steve reports on one of the world's biggest gatherings of hammerhead sharks in the Bahamas. Last in the series.(n) Nature Animals
0.3/4.
5.4/10
Line of Duty New series. An attack is made on a police transport carrying seized drugs, leaving three officers dead. Suspicion immediately falls on the head of a criminal syndicate, who is suspected of having police officers on his payroll providing him with information. AC-12 are assigned to investigate and root out the corrupt cops - but realise they are up against their most destructive adversary yet. The return of Jed Mercurio's police thriller, starring Adrian Dunbar, Vicky McClure, Martin Compston and Stephen Graham.(n) Detective Thriller
4.0/6.
6.4/10

Weather 31/03/2019 Weather
8.8/10
Match of the Day 2 31/03/2019 Mark Chapman reviews the day's Premier League action, introducing highlights of Liverpool v Tottenham Hotspur at Anfield and Cardiff City v Chelsea at the Cardiff City Stadium. Jurgen Klopp's Reds were looking for three points to maintain their challenge for a first top-flight title in 29 years, while Mauricio Pochettino's Spurs were aiming for their first league win at Anfield since May 2011. Cardiff were thumped 4-1 at Chelsea back in September, and both sides were desperate for three points as they sought to reach their goals at opposite ends of the table.(n) Football Soccer
8.1/10
The Women's Football Show 31/03/2019 Highlights of the weekend's games in the Super League, and a look at the biggest issues in the women's game. Chelsea are the defending champions, but face stiff competition from the likes of the most successful English women's team in history Arsenal, last season's runners-up Manchester City and the much-improved Birmingham City.(n) Football Soccer

Blue Planet Live Chris Packham, Steve Backshall and Liz Bonnin conclude the week of live programmes with a look at what the future holds for the next generation of marine life, and how scientists are embracing new forms of technology to help preserve sea life. Chris studies humpback whales at the Baja Peninsula, Liz hears an underwater dawn chorus in Australia, as well as encountering turtle hatchlings and fluorescent corals, while Steve reports on one of the world's biggest gatherings of hammerhead sharks in the Bahamas. Last in the series.(n) Nature Animals

Match of the Day 2 31/03/2019 Mark Chapman reviews the day's Premier League action, introducing highlights of Liverpool v Tottenham Hotspur at Anfield and Cardiff City v Chelsea at the Cardiff City Stadium. Jurgen Klopp's Reds were looking for three points to maintain their challenge for a first top-flight title in 29 years, while Mauricio Pochettino's Spurs were aiming for their first league win at Anfield since May 2011. Nature's Miracle Babies Martin Hughes-Games explores the ground-breaking work being done by breeding programmes protecting some of the most threatened animals. Australia: Earth's Magical Kingdom Human An exploration how native creatures have adapted to survive in the human environment. In Melbourne, tree-dwelling possums have taken to sharing trees in city parks, risking encounters with traffic and cats. In Brisbane's parks, over the past 150 years of so, eastern water dragons have become twice the size of their wild cousins and without trees to climb their limbs are getting longer and claws shorter. Beyond the cities, dingoes eek out an existence in the inhospitable environment of a desert goldmine, while climate change and deforestation is posing a threat to koalas. Narrated by Barry Humphries. Last in the series.(n) General Education Science
0.2/3.
8.8/10
Inside the Factory Cheese Gregg Wallace visits a cheese factory in Gateshead, where 3,000 tonnes of spreadable cheese are produced every year. He follows the production of jalapeno chilli flavoured cheese, from a 28,000-litre delivery of milk to 5,400 squeezy tubes. Meanwhile, Cherry Healey finds out how bacteria are responsible for the huge variety in smell, taste and appearance of different types of cheese. She also learns that some smelly cheeses contain the same bacteria that are responsible for stinky feet. Last in the series.(n) Documentary

Showbands: How Ireland Learnt to Party The showband was a uniquely Irish phenomenon. It was a movement that saw thousands of young people travel up and down the country in the late '50s, '60s and early '70s to the `Dancehalls of Romance' to be entertained by the Royal Showband, the Miami Showband and Big Tom and the Mainliners, and individuals including Dickie Rock, Joe Dolan and Brendan Bowyer. Ardal O'Hanlon looks back at the phenomenon, examining what triggered the infamous era, the people involved, and its eventual end in the 1980s.(n) General Music Ballet Dance

Made in Great Britain Cheese Steph McGovern leads the makers to Wensleydale in the Yorkshire Dales, where they examine the area's famous cheese, as championed by Wallace and Gromit. Focusing on the Monastic period, Jason and Claire try to milk a sheep, while Katie and Charlton extract rennet - an enzyme vital in cheesemaking - from a sheep's stomach. Moving on to the Victorian era, Charlton and Jason tackle the highly physical task of collecting 20 litres of milk each in heavy back cans. The makers are then propelled to the 1920s when early factories employed equipment such as thermometers to produce cheese on a much larger scale.(n) Documentary 0.4/6.
3.5/10
Australia: Earth's Magical Kingdom Human An exploration how native creatures have adapted to survive in the human environment. In Melbourne, tree-dwelling possums have taken to sharing trees in city parks, risking encounters with traffic and cats. In Brisbane's parks, over the past 150 years of so, eastern water dragons have become twice the size of their wild cousins and without trees to climb their limbs are getting longer and claws shorter. Beyond the cities, dingoes eek out an existence in the inhospitable environment of a desert goldmine, while climate change and deforestation is posing a threat to koalas. Narrated by Barry Humphries. Last in the series.(n) General Education Science 0.2/3.
8.8/10
Scrum V Scrum V Sunday: 31/03/2019 Gareth Rhys Owen is joined by Andrew Coombs and Mark Jones to present action from the Plate and Bowl semi-finals, as well as the key moments from the Principality Premiership.(n) Rugby Union - International
8.2/10
The Hairy Bikers' Asian Adventure Thailand (Bangkok and the Central Plains) Dave Myers and Si King continue their culinary journey around Asia by heading to Thailand, where they discover why Bangkok has a reputation as the street food capital of the world, and help serve up school dinners. Heading out into the country's central plains, the duo join paddy-field workers and find out how rice is grown.(n) Cooking 0.1/6.
2/10
Dragons' Den Peter Jones, Deborah Meaden, Touker Suleyman, Jenny Campbell and Tej Lalvani assess the profit-making potential of more business ideas, including a keen fisherman with a plan to market his own range of bait, a pasta home delivery service, and a brother and sister with a scheme to make money out of rubbish. Evan Davis presents.(n) General Education Science 15.2/16.
5.4/10
Race Across the World The four remaining teams travel through Cambodia and Vietnam. Darron and Alex are 24 hours ahead of the others, but they are running out of money quickly - a trip into the jungle to work with elephants may prove the solution. Josh and Felix's partnership is strained by a visit to a brothel, while a toilet break proves to have serious consequences for Tony and Elaine.(n) Adventure 0.4/6.
7.6/10
Natural World Tasmania: Weird and Wonderful David Attenborough narrates footage of the Australian island state's wildlife. The programme reveals a surprisingly gentle side to the island's most famous resident, the Tasmanian devil, and also features footage of rare white wallabies, venomous jack jumper ants, and caves illuminated by thousands of glow worms. Tasmania's rivers are home to platypus and giant lobsters, while on the coast, miniature penguins come ashore to breed.(n) Nature Animals 36.7.
8.9/10
My Autistic Big Brother & Me Documentary following a man's fight to prevent his autistic brother from being institutionalised. 47-year-old Spencer McKay finds everyday tasks a great challenge, but thrives on walking in mountain regions, coping with all weathers and the most rugged terrain. His younger brother Mikey is determined to ensure he continues to enjoy this freedom, which he believes is vital to Spencer's quality of life.(n) Documentary
The Unexplainers New series. Mike Bubbins and John Rutledge investigate Wales' most mysterious mysteries, from aliens to ghost animals. They begin by examining reports of a big cat on the loose in North Wales, with a complicated mix of CCTV, woodwork and cold meat yielding some unexpected results, while they also set sail on a lake near Bala to search for a reported monster.(n) Unexplained Mysteries 0.0/3.
White Gold With Jo now co-managing Cachet Windows, she uses her power to expose Lavender and Sam's past and gains the upper hand over Vincent. Long Lost Family Peter Gunn, a 39-year-old man whose birth mother gave him up for adoption when he was only nine months old, sets out to track down his biological mum. For years, Peter struggled with a sense of rejection as a result of being parted from his natural parents at such an early age, but having overcome his resentments, he now seeks to answer some burning questions about his past. Meanwhile, 71-year-old north Wales resident Ron Williams asks for help in his lifelong quest to track down the estranged younger sister with whom he spent an idyllic childhood - until she was adopted away from the family. Presented by Davina McCall and Nicky Campbell.(n) Challenge Reality Show 4.2/6.
5.1/10
Agatha Christie's Marple Murder Is Easy Ever since a beautiful American woman arrived in the peaceful village of Wychwood-under-Ashe, people have begun to die in a series of apparent accidents. Nobody suspects a killer is at work but, as the body count rises, Miss Marple digs a little deeper with the help of a former policeman - and they gradually unearth a secret that will rock the village to its core. Murder mystery, starring Julia McKenzie, Benedict Cumberbatch, David Haig, Sylvia Syms, Margo Stilley and Hugo Speer.(n) Mystery 3.1/4.
7.5/10
Agatha Christie's Marple Why Didn't They Ask Evans? As the sole witness to a dying man's last words, Bobby Attfield is determined to solve the riddle they present, and forms an unlikely alliance with socialite Frankie Derwent and visiting family friend Miss Marple to help him on his quest. A trail of clues leads them to Castle Savage, where they uncover a hotbed of stifled emotion, treachery and deceit among its strange inhabitants. Murder mystery, starring Julia McKenzie, with a supporting cast that includes Sean Biggerstaff, Samantha Bond, Richard Briers, Rafe Spall, Warren Clarke, Mark Williams, Georgia Moffett, Helen Lederer and Rik Mayall. Last in the series.(n) Mystery 3.3/4.

7.3/10
Agatha Christie's Poirot The Disappearance of Mr Davenheim A wealthy banker goes missing while walking from his country house to the village post office. David Suchet stars.(n) Detective Thriller 1.4/9.
7.3/10
Vera Telling Tales Following the suicide of Jeanie Long, the woman convicted of the murder of teenager Abigail Mantel 11 years earlier, new evidence comes to light exonerating her. DCI Vera Stanhope reinvestigates the case, but to find out who really killed Abigail, the detective must uncover the secrets of a close-knit community that is still coming to terms with the incident. Detective drama, adapted from Ann Cleeves' novel Telling Tales, guest starring Hugo Speer alongside Brenda Blethyn, David Leon, Wunmi Mosaku and Paul Ritter.(n) Detective Thriller 0.1/4.

Sir Cliff Richard: 60 Years in Public and in Private A profile of the singer filmed over a six-month period at his home in Portugal, at Abbey Road Studios and at Wimbledon, examining his career highs and lows and his record-breaking longevity. Cliff talks about the dark days that followed the police raid on his home in 2014, his battle to clear his name and the people whose support have got him through tough times. Featuring interviews with Barry Gibb, Olivia Newton-John, Hank Marvin, Jimmy Osmond, Andrew Lloyd Webber, Brian May and Joan Collins.(n) General Music Ballet Dance

Grantchester As Gary Bell waits for news about whether he will be offered a reprieve, Geordie and Phil discover a reason to arrest Eddie Jones, a violent husband who beats his wife. However, when Sidney arrives at the station the following morning, he finds Geordie with his knuckles bruised and Eddie dead on a stretcher. Chief Inspector Benson questions his innocence, and although the vicar leaps to his friend's defence, no one can verify his whereabouts when Eddie was killed. At the vicarage, a remark about Mrs Maguire's love life and the accidental loss of some sentimental postcards leave the housekeeper and Leonard feeling raw and misunderstood.(n) Historical Period Drama 1.4/6.

Secret History The Dambusters' Great Escape: Secret History Dubbed `The Beast' by Winston Churchill, Tirpitz was Nazi Germany's most powerful battleship. Protected by an elite squadron of fighters, it was seen as invincible, but after 34 failed attempts to sink it, the RAF sent in the 617 `Dambusters' Squadron and 9 Squadron. In a raid in November 1944 they managed to slip through enemy defences and destroy Tirpitz. With eyewitness accounts from surviving RAF crew, one of the Luftwaffe fighter pilots and German sailors, this documentary tells this extraordinary story and offers new evidence to explain the mission's improbable success.(n) Documentary

Giant otter couple Diego and Icana are the best of friends but have never mated, so keepers hope a new male will have what it takes to relight Icana's fire. Blue morpho butterflies Macuna and Peanut also need to mate, but when their diet of fruit ferments and turns to alcohol, their drunken behaviour might dash Chester's hopes of producing the next generation of butterflies. The Great British Bake Off Tarts The 10 remaining amateur cooks' tart-making abilities are put to the test in the third round of the competition. The hopefuls then face another daunting technical challenge as they try to replicate Mary's seemingly straightforward recipe for treacle tart, but the delicate task of adding a lattice top leaves some contestants flummoxed. Finally, they try to create an ornate fruit tart fit for gracing the window display of a leading patisserie - before discovering the identities of the latest Star Baker and the person who will be heading home. Louis Theroux Louis travels to San Francisco, where pioneering medical professionals are helping children who say they were born in the wrong body to transition from one sex to the other. At the Child and Adolescent Gender Centre at UCSF Hospital, he meets youngsters who have been diagnosed with gender dysphoria and who are undergoing medical interventions, from puberty blockers to hormone-replacement therapy and ultimately gender-reassignment surgery. Louis spends time with the clinic's patients and their families as they negotiate their way along this life-changing and emotional journey.(n)
Tom Barrow Aysha Rafaele Louis Theroux

12 Year Old Lifer: True Stories In April 2010, 12-year-old Paul Gingerich helped his friend Colt Lundy, 15, shoot and kill his stepfather Phillip Danner in the US state of Indiana. With access to both boys and their families, this film explores their case, offering an insight into the crime and its aftermath. The programme finds out how Paul's relatives waged a controversial appeal for him to be retried as a juvenile, meaning he could avoid being transferred to an adult prison when he's old enough.(n)
